(d) CERES grants IGER the discretionary power, at its sole option and without prior notice to CERES, to terminate this Agreement under any of the following circumstances:

   (i) If IGER determines, in its reasonable discretion, that CERES has initiated or is facing bankruptcy, insolvency, receivership, trust, deed, creditors arrangement, or comparable proceedings; such proceedings are not dismissed within 120 days.

   (ii) In the event of CERES' dissolution or winding up, except where all or a substantial portion of CERES' assets, stock, or business relevant to this Agreement are acquired by a third party through any means, including but not limited to sale, acquisition, merger, or operation of law.

The Responsibilities herein are distributed as follows:

Instituto Superior de Agronomia (Portugal) shall have the primary role in the agronomy of Cynara, Arundo, Sorghum, with a secondary focus on harvesting these crops.

Associacao de Prudutores Florestias (Portugal), in collaboration with Instituto Superior de Agronomia, shall oversee the agronomy, harvesting, and conversion processes of Cynara, Arundo, and Sorghum.

Universidade de Evora (Portugal) shall be responsible for the agronomy aspects related to the harvesting of Cynara and Sorghum.

The Instituto Nacional de Engenharia, Tecnologia e Invacao (Portugal) shall take charge of the gasification and combustion processes of Cynara, Arunda, and Sorghum.

Associacao Florestal da Galizia (Spain) shall be in charge of analyzing the combustion of these crops and producing alcohol from Cynara, Arunda, and Sorghum.

Mid-South Roscommon Rural Development Company Ltd (Ireland), as a cooperative effort, shall identify and assess the performance of biomass crops including miscanthus, reed canary grass, and willow on the farms under its purview. This includes monitoring their growth and yield, but does not necessarily imply direct responsibility for improving their performance.
